definition: (bound form used in 忙碌[mang2 lu4], 勞碌|劳碌[lao2 lu4], 庸碌[yong1 lu4] etc)

sentences.english: He's incompetent and not worth keeping on.
sentences.chinese: 他庸碌無能，不值得留用。

sentences.english: You know sometimes I think my whole life is spent in one long effort to escape from the common places of existence.
sentences.chinese: 有時我覺得我的一生都在苦苦掙扎以擺脫庸碌平凡。

sentences.english: I should finish life mediocre and unambitious.
Born mediocre and unambitious , I have always been endowed with great things.
sentences.chinese: 我生而庸碌，上天卻總是賜予我美好的東西。

sentences.english: India is the country which has the most talented, yet ineffective middle class.
sentences.chinese: 印度有最有才但庸碌的中產階級。

definition: to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
